events.title: ITS Student Worker, Truman State University
Flash Game Developer, How Machines Work
Blackout Blitz dev Big Run Studios hires Benjamin Jordan as new CTO
NFT Collectors Are Geniuses
events.subtitle: Published in Coinmonks.
events.description: NFTs may be mathematically attractive but daggum if they aren't complicated. So complicated that most of them are horribly broken.

events.title: In which I probably invented a whole new branch of mathematics and computer science
events.subtitle: Published in Geek Culture.
events.description: My love for literature and math leads me down a strange path... Follow along in WONDER on a numerical exploration of classic authors.

events.title: Doug McIlroy vs Donald Knuth
events.subtitle: Published in CodeX.
events.description: Storytelling is a lost art in software engineering. What happens when you pit massive brains against one another?

events.title: Programming where Failure is Not an Option
events.subtitle: Published in CodeX.
events.description: Are we coding for space shuttles here? Why are we so afraid of failure?

events.title: What is the point of higher education in computer science?
events.subtitle: Published in CodeX.
events.description: Now that I'm officially a highly professional academic, I realize I have no clue what I should be doing.

events.title: GitHub Copilot and major world religions
events.subtitle: Published in Geek Culture.
events.description: My little AI co-programmer is quickly becoming an indispensible tool. Let's talk about metaphysics-- wait what?

events.title: Shaping Young Minds with Agile Thinking
events.subtitle: Published in Geek Culture.
events.description: Why Agile methodology matters, and how I'm teaching it to CS masters students. If only someone had shown me these things when I was a whipper-snapper!

events.title: How many bugs should your product have?
events.subtitle: Published in CodeX.
events.description: It's a tough question, but it's one we should be asking ourselves: how many bugs should our product have before we show it to someone?

events.title: What you can't know about being a startup CTO
events.subtitle: Published in CodeX.
events.description: The term 'Startup CTO' can mean just about anything, depending on the startup-- but there is one thing they all have in common: wrestling with the unknown.

events.title: Embrace AI pair programming or perish
events.subtitle: Published in CodeX.
events.description: The future is here and the only choice we have is how to respond: do we reject it, or do we embrace it?

events.title: The Binary Search Methodology
events.subtitle: Published in CodeX.
events.description: A practical methodology for building software that I completely made up in a vacuum and is completely original.

events.title: Why Proof of Work is elegant and Proof of Stake is not
events.subtitle: Published in Coinmonks.
events.description: What can I say, I'm a sucker for elegant math. Proof of Stake is not the picture of elegance its older brother is.

events.title: Take the Time to Write Less Code
events.subtitle: Published in CodeX.
events.description: Something from Pascal the programmer: please take the time to write less code. Thank you.

events.title: Webtrono.me
events.description: Web-based metronomes are terrible, but not this one! A configurable, sample-accurate metronome in the browser. Create your routine and track your progress with your new practice buddy.

events.title: Nk-Js
events.description: Nk-js is an end-to-end encrypted js library for use with nk-server: the no-knowledge store.

events.title: Nk-Server
events.description: No peeking. An end-to-end encrypted, no-knowledge key/value storage server.

events.title: Ffabricator
events.description: A simple Akka + ASP.NET server that creates HLS streams from WebM or MP4 videos.

events.title: Nano Watch
events.description: Nano watch is a simple web app that watches nanopool mining rigs and pushes browser notifications when the monitored rigs dip below a target hashrate.

events.title: Enkluplayer
events.description: Enkluplayer was a collaborative, cross-platform multiplayer AR runtime that is unfortunately now closed-source. Live behavior and UI scripting across devices. Drag and drop asset import. Enkluplayer lets users collaboratively design and publish multiplayer-by-default AR experiences.

events.title: Enklu Cloud
events.description: Enklu Cloud is the leading platform for collaborative authoring and sharing of immersive multiplayer AR experiences.

events.title: HoloLens 2 Multiplayer
events.description: We created a multiplayer spellcasting demo in just a few hours for an invite-only tech day at Microsoft Reactor.

events.title: Conversational AI World Building
events.description: At another invite-only Microsoft hackathon, I created a prototype for a conversational world-building application using Azure's LUIS and Enklu. The computer asks what you see and builds the scene as you describe it.

events.title: Azure Kinect + Enklu
events.description: We were the first to adapt the Azure Kinect to live entertainment by adding Azure Kinect support to Enkluplayer. This ran as an interactive installation at Universal Studios in LA where lightning shot from your fingertips.

events.title: 100 HoloLens Multiplayer @ E3
events.description: We created the world's first 100 HoloLens multiplayer experience at E3. Over 7500 attendees were able to put on a HoloLens and explore magical powers in the Unreal Garden.

events.title: Kinect + Enklu + E3
events.description: At E3, we used our Kinect v2 integration to give wings to passers-by.

events.title: Mamba
events.description: Mamba is a .NET Core application that connects Kinect stream data to the Enklu multiplayer servers. In this way, we could attach assets to body parts and sync them between 'multiverse mirrors' and HoloLenses.

events.title: Chelydra
events.description: Chelydra is a .NET Core controller that connects a DSLR camera to Enklu multiplayer services. HoloLens players can trigger pictures to be taken via AR controls.

events.title: Quicktype Maintainer
events.description: Major contributor to go and csharp generators and original creator or prop-types generator.

events.title: Unity Plugin
events.description: Gradle plugin for running Unity from a gradle task.

events.title: NaturalLogger
events.description: A Unity library for sending logs to Natural-Log.

events.title: Natural-Log
events.description: A socket server and slick client, wrapped in a cross platform binary using Electron.io.

events.title: Core-AVR
events.description: Libraries for working with 32-bit Atmel AVR microcontrollers. They are not good.

events.title: Stegasaurus
events.description: Hide data in pictures (steganography), which are then stored in plain sight: on Facebook. Stegasaurus encrypts data with a one time pad, which is then stored... in other pictures.

events.title: Jint-Unity
events.description: A Javascript interpreter for Unity.

events.title: Story
events.description: Story is a research project that leverages the Python NLT and machine learning techniques for gaming. It's a reverse text adventure. The goal is to use natural language input to describe an environment to a computer, which then makes choices about how to use the environment to accomplish the described goal.

events.title: Playing With Cinder
events.description: My first project using Cinder. It's very simple, linking luma from a video capture source to various properties of a bunch of circles (in the biz we call them particles).

events.title: Email Backup
events.description: A set of tools for backing up email. Yes, it sounds boring, but it was fun and I needed something simple.

events.title: Itsy
events.description: A cute name for an otherwise uncaring software-rendered particle system.

events.title: Dependency Injection in Unity3d
events.description: A couple classes for using Ninject as a dependency injection solution in Unity3d.

events.title: Kristmas Klein Bagel
events.description: A short exploration of generating a 3d immersion of a 4d Klein bottle.

events.title: Separating Axes Theorem
events.description: A very basic implementation of the separating axes theorem for collision detection. This was created for illustrative purposes, and has, let's say, a few bugs.

events.title: All Mine
events.description: A simple game built with Cocos2d that expands on Minesweeper. Energy, biodiesel, unit types and actions-- lots of fun stuff!

events.title: Telemetrino
events.description: Strapping an Arduino + accelerometer to an RC car.

events.title: Fabric Sim
events.description: A simple fabric simulation. Uses a spring system with point masses and Verlet integration. The original used my own graphics engine, but this uses ThreeJS.

events.title: boX
events.description: That's not an 'x' at all! It's a chi! A 2D WebGL graphics engine, twice as pretentious as LateX.

events.title: On Geosphere Construction
events.description: The geometrical construction of a sphere based on the subdivision of an icosahedron. This method creates a sphere where each triangle is the same size.

events.title: Realtime Clouds on the GPU
events.description: A two part study into noise functions and how they might be used to create purely GPU-based moving clouds.

events.title: Spherical Terrain Generation
events.description: Everyone has created flat procedural terrain-- but what methods can be used for generating spherical terrain? This two part post builds on geospheres and explores one method of geometry creation and one method for an accompanying Earthlike shader.

events.title: Porter Stemmer
events.description: An ancient and naive implementation of Porter's stemming algorithm. Essentially, it takes words and decomposes them down to their root.

events.title: Scorched3D
events.description: Now in 2D! An ancient, Scorched Earth style, software rendered, hot-seat multiplayer extravaganza.

events.title: Scorched Earth Style Terrain
events.description: For those of you wanting to generate interesting 2D terrains, similar to the Mother of All Games: Scorched Earth. These don't use silly fractals or perlin-- those are too boring!

events.title: Einstein
events.description: A relativity engine-- essentially any object in the scene can be the Observer, and every object has a clock. Both time and space are transformed by speed relative to the current Observer.

events.title: SOS
events.description: An XML log target for SOS Max that works across AS3 and JS.
